bibl.title: Letter from A.S. von Mansfelde to Mabel H. Lazear, June 25, 1908

div1.p: Von Mansfelde asks why he has not heard from Mabel Lazear.

div1.head: Letter from A.S. von Mansfelde to Mabel H. Lazear, June 25, 1908
div1.opener:
Nebraska State Medical Association
A. S. v. Mansfelde, M. D. Treasurer
“Quality Hill,” Ashland, Nebraska
No. 2955.
June 25th 1908.
Mrs Mabel H. Lazear.
Santa Barbara.
Cal.
Dear Mrs Lazear:
div1.p:
I have just returned from
a visit of two weeks to Mr. Thomas C. La-
zear, Pittsburgh. I brought home with
me most delightful memories of a very
pleasant visit and being wishes in the
personal acquaintance with one, who surely
deserves your many praises. On my re-
turn home I find no word from you
since I sent the last telegram and my
last two letters!

As soon as I can catch up with
some work, which has been neglected in
the last three months, I will look up
your personal letters, your husbands
and others, which you may wish to
have returned to you, and send them
to you.

Nebraska State Medical Association
A. S. v. Mansfelde, M. D., Treasurer
“Quality Hill,” Ashland, Nebraska

I have suffered for the last 5 weeks
with a badly inflamed eye, to an ex-
tent of making writing and reading
a misery; and yet I have, thus handi-
capped, contrived to attend the Nebras-
ka State Medical Association meeting,
that of the American Medical Association
at Chicago and two weeks at Pittsburgh.

I hope your good fortune sits
lightly on your shoulders. I trust
it will be a perpetual blessing
to you.
div1.closer:
Must cordially your friend ASvMansfelde I brought a splendid picture of Mr
Lazear, your husbands - Mr Jesse T.
Lazears and his son John's with me.
from the East.
ASvM.
